• The darker and more
    colorful lettuce has more
    vitamins and minerals!
    It's a member of the
    sunflower family.

  • Eggplants are
    actually berries!
    In England they are
    called aubergines.

  • Cauliflower is a cruciferous
    vegetable full of nutrients
    that may help prevent cancer.

  • Celery is a negative
    calorie food meaning that it
    takes more calories to digest
    the healthy fiber
    than you absorb.

  • Avocados are one
    of the few fruits to
    contain healthy fats.
    They grow on an
    evergreen tree.

  • A slice of cucumber
    pressed against the roof
    of your mouth for 30 seconds
    will eliminate bad breath.

  • Carrots are usually orange but
    purple, white, yellow
    and red also exist.
    Great source of vitamin A.

  • Pumpkins are grown
    everywhere in the world
    except Antartica.

  • Potatoes were taken up
    with the shuttle Columbia
    and were the first food
    grown in outer space!

  • If you leave a
    green pepper on the vine
    it will turn red.

  • In Australia, they put
    pickled beets on hamburgers!

  • Zucchini has more
    potassium than a banana.
    You can even eat the flower!
